macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US500 Index Falls 0.11% to 6969 Points on January 13
items.summary: The main US stock market index, US500, declined 0.11% to 6969 points on January 13, 2026, amid mixed trading. Over the past month, it has risen 1.20% and is up 18.80% year-over-year.

items.title: US Stocks Close Mixed as Investors Weigh Economic Data and Fed Easing Expectations
items.summary: US stocks ended mixed on Wednesday with S&P 500 down 0.2%, Dow sliding 0.8%, and Nasdaq 100 up 0.1%, influenced by cooling JOLTS job openings, ADP hiring rebound, and strong ISM Services PMI. Banks like JPMorgan and Bank of America fell over 2%, while NVIDIA and Alphabet gained.

items.title: Upcoming US PPI, Retail Sales, and Major Bank Earnings to Drive Markets on January 14
items.summary: Key US macroeconomic releases including Producer Price Index (PPI) and Retail Sales, alongside earnings from Citigroup, Wells Fargo, and Bank of America, are expected to trigger volatility in S&P 500 and global indices like Nikkei 225.

items.title: S&P 500 Shows Sideways Action with Bullish Indicators Amid Low Volatility
items.summary: The S&P 500 has traded sideways for six to seven weeks with low VIX at 14-15%, maintaining bullish price action and candles. Recent support tested at 6580, with current levels near 6970, about 7% above lows.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Surges Above $95,000 on Cooling U.S. Inflation Data
items.summary: Bitcoin traded above $95,500 and altcoins extended gains as traders reacted to lower-than-expected U.S. inflation data, boosting risk appetite across digital assets. Total crypto market cap approached $3.25 trillion with improving sentiment.[1]

items.title: Senate Advances CLARITY Act for Crypto Market Structure
items.summary: Lawmakers progressed the Digital Asset Market Clarity Act of 2025 (CLARITY Act), aiming to clarify regulatory roles between SEC and CFTC, lifting regulatory sentiment. Senate Banking Committee released full draft ahead of markup.[1][4]

items.title: Polygon Labs Acquires Coinme and Sequence to Expand Stablecoin Payments
items.summary: Polygon Labs CEO discussed acquisitions of crypto payments firm Coinme and digital asset infrastructure provider Sequence to strengthen Polygon's position in stablecoin payments.[4]

items.title: Bitcoin Consolidates Near Record Highs Around $92,000-$95,000
items.summary: Bitcoin fluctuated around $92,000-$95,500 after hitting a peak of $94,400 earlier in January, with forecasts predicting potential growth to $101,305 amid bullish trends.[1][2][3]

items.title: New U.S. Crypto Tax Reporting Rules Effective 2026
items.summary: Treasury and IRS finalized regulations requiring brokers to report crypto transaction cost basis starting January 1, 2026, integrating digital assets into tax frameworks.[5]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Materials Project Advances AI Revolution in Materials Science with Google DeepMind Contribution
items.summary: The Materials Project, a major repository of curated materials data, is accelerating machine learning applications in materials discovery. Google DeepMind contributed nearly 400,000 new compounds to the platform, enabling researchers to predict material properties and design new materials much faster for energy technologies and other applications.

items.title: Generative AI System Outperforms Human Experts at Detecting Blood Cell Abnormalities
items.summary: Researchers at the University of Cambridge developed a generative AI system that analyzes blood cells with greater accuracy than human experts and demonstrates superior ability to recognize its own uncertainty. The system can detect subtle signs of diseases like leukemia while maintaining metacognitive awareness of its limitations.

items.title: Meta Commits $600 Billion to AI Infrastructure Development Through 2028
items.summary: Meta announced a decade-long plan to develop global AI infrastructure with over $600 billion in U.S. spending through 2028, shifting focus away from metaverse goals toward superintelligence development. The company hired Dina Powell McCormick as president to oversee the initiative.

items.title: Pattern Computer Unveils Explainable AI Platform with Hallucination-Free Pattern Discovery
items.summary: Pattern Computer's PatternDE (PDE) AI platform uses proprietary pattern discovery algorithms to reveal hidden relationships in complex data without the hallucinations common to language models. The approach prioritizes explainability, transparency, and biological validation across biotech, diagnostics, and enterprise applications.

items.title: Trump Administration and U.S. States Expected to Clash Over AI Regulations in 2026
items.summary: The Trump Administration's December 2025 executive order seeking a 'minimally burdensome national standard' for AI is expected to conflict with state-level regulations. Senator Marsha Blackburn introduced the TRUMP AMERICA AI Act to create unified federal AI rules, with more congressional proposals anticipated.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Meta Shuts Down Three VR Game Studios
items.summary: Meta has reportedly shut down three VR-focused game studios: Sanzaru Games, Armature Studio, and Twisted Pixel, marking a significant shift in the company's gaming strategy.

items.title: DC Universe Online Announces Alt-Kick System and New Powers
items.summary: DC Universe Online's new development team has released a Producer's Letter detailing the Alt-Kick System for alternate characters and the introduction of the White Lantern Power, marking significant progress under new leadership.

items.title: Resident Evil Showcase Announced for January 15, 2026
items.summary: Capcom has announced a Resident Evil Showcase event scheduled for January 15, 2026, with details expected to be revealed about upcoming titles in the franchise.

items.title: WHO Hosts Webinar on Social Health and Digital Play
items.summary: The World Health Organization is hosting a virtual webinar on January 14, 2026, examining the impact of video games on health and well-being, including discussions on gaming disorder and commercial determinants of health.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Trump Promises Microsoft Will Cover AI Data Center Energy Costs for Americans
items.summary: US President Donald Trump announced Microsoft will implement major changes this week to prevent American households from paying higher electricity bills due to the tech giant's power-intensive data centers. The move addresses rising utility costs in multiple states amid Big Tech's energy demands.

items.title: Microsoft's Brad Smith Urges Big Tech to Fully Fund AI Data Center Infrastructure
items.summary: Microsoft President Brad Smith met with lawmakers to advocate that the tech industry, not taxpayers, cover the full costs of AI data centers, amid concerns over electricity and water usage. President Trump endorsed the effort, highlighting commitments to minimize community impacts.

items.title: Allianz Risk Barometer 2026: Cyber Incidents Top Business Risks Globally
items.summary: Cyber incidents, particularly ransomware, remain the number one risk for companies worldwide for the fifth consecutive year, according to the Allianz Risk Barometer released January 14, 2026. Political risks and violence also rose to their highest-ever position at #7.

items.title: Experts Call for Expanded US Offensive Cyber Operations in House Hearing
items.summary: Cybersecurity experts testified before the House that the US must integrate cyber operations fully into military doctrine to avoid being hamstrung against threats. The hearing emphasized the need for large-scale offensive cyber capabilities.
